Class NecesaryPriorityQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • NecesaryPriorityQueue
  • public class NecesaryPriorityQueue
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains a heap (represented as an array), a size variable, which represents the number of elements in the heap and a writer to print the priority queue in a given file.
    I've named this class NecesaryPriorityQueue in order to avoid the overriding of the already existing PriorityQueue class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      NecesaryPriorityQueue​(int maxsize, java.io.File output)
      Builds a heap which can have at most maxsize elements that would be printed in the output file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NecesaryPriorityQueue

        public NecesaryPriorityQueue​(int maxsize,
                             java.io.File output)
                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Builds a heap which can have at most maxsize elements that would be printed in the output file.
        Note: The array is implemented from 0 to ((no. of elements) - 1).
        Parameters:
        maxsize - maximum number of elements in the array
        output - output file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

    • Method Detail

      • parent

        public int parent​(int i)
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the element
        Returns:
        The index of the parent node of queue[i].

      • leftChild

        public int leftChild​(int i)
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the element
        Returns:
        The index of the left node of queue[i].

      • rightChild

        public int rightChild​(int i)
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the element
        Returns:
        The index of the right node of queue[i].

      • heapify

        public void heapify​(int i)
        If the parent's priority is lower than the priority of either one of his children, then the parent and the child with the greater priority will change their values. This procedure continues until the parent's priority is greater or equal to the priorities of his children, or until the parent doesn't have any children.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the heap to be evaluated

      • insert

        public void insert​(Passenger p,
                   int priority)
        Adds a new passenger p with the priority priority in the priority queue. If this new passenger has a priority greater than his parent, then these 2 will change places in the queue. This procedure repeats until the inserted value is higher in the queue than all of his parents with a lower priority than his.
        Parameters:
        p - the passenger to be inserted
        priority - the coresponding priority

      • embark

        public void embark()
        Removes the root of the queue. All the other elements will stay the same, but the new root will be the last element from the initial queue array. This new root will be "heapified", in order to maintain the heap priority of the array.

      • delete

        public void delete​(Passenger p)
        Deletes a given passenger from the queue and rearranges the queue as a max-heap.
        Parameters:
        p - the passenger to be removed

      • print

        public void print​(int i)
           throws java.io.IOException
        This is a recursive function which prints the i-th element of the array. Once it has been printed, this function will be called in preorder (root - left - right), so we can print alll the elements of the array / queue.
        Parameters:
        i - the index from which the program starts printing the queue elements
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • list

        public void list()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Lists all the elements from the heap, starting with its root, in preorder.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • closeWriter

        public void closeWriter()
        Closes the used writer.
